page.description: Create an invisible modeless dialog (which can be later shown).

argument.name: format
argument.description: A series of Xdialog commands that describe the appearance of the dialog box.

item.name: <<%dlg%
item.description: The only optional part of this argument is the "dlg" sequence of characters (the marker), which can be any string of characters, as long as it is unique within this instance of the UI_DLG_BOX() function. The character sequence <<%dlg% is specifically recommended because it is supported by bubble help.

item.name: Xdialog_Code
item.description: One or more statements, each of which must be on a separate line from the <<%dlg% and %dlg% arguments.

item.name: %dlg%
item.description: The marker characters can be any string of characters, as long as they match those in the first argument ( <<%dlg% ).

argument.name: code
argument.description: Optional. Xbasic code that describes what should happen when various events happen when the user is interacting with the dialog box. For example, what should happen when the user presses a button, or when the user tabs out of a field.

page.discussion: The UI_DLG_CREATE() function creates an invisible modeless dialog, which can later be displayed.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example creates an invisible dialog with UI_DLG_CREATE(), then displays it with UI_DLG_SHOW().
